```{r}
library(dplyr)
# Function that runs the Monty Hall problem
monty_hall <- function(guess = integer, change_guess = Boolean) {
  
  # Randomly sets one door to be true, the others to be false
  doors <- sample(c(rep(TRUE, 1), rep(FALSE, 2)), 3, replace = F)
  indicies <- 1:3

  # Open one of the false doors randomly that is not the given guess
  potential_removable_doors <- indicies[-c(which(doors), guess)]
  remove_idx <- sample(potential_removable_doors, 1)
  doors[remove_idx] <- NA

  if((change_guess && !doors[guess]) || (!change_guess && doors[guess])){
    print("You won!")
  }
  else{
    print("You Lost!")}
}

iterations <- 10000
monty_hall(1, TRUE)

```
